properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA out 10 nm
properties.headline: Hazardous Seas Warning issued February 11 at 2:36PM PST until February 12 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...A steep 8 to 10 ft from the northwest in the advisory
area. A very steep 10 to 12 feet, at times, from the northwest
in the warning area.

* WHERE...The advisory is in effect from much of the area south of
Port Orford. The warning is primarily from 5 NM to 40 NM of the
coast from Gold Beach southward.

* WHEN...For the Hazardous Seas Warning, until 10 PM PST
Wednesday. For the Small Craft Advisory, until 4 AM PST
Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Steep seas could capsize or damage smaller vessels.
Very steep seas could negatively affect larger vessel traffic.
Bar crossing will become especially treacherous.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
Recreational boaters should remain in port. Commercial vessels
should prepare for very steep seas and consider remaining in port
until conditions improve.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS SEAS WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST WEDNESDAY... ...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST THURSDAY
